name: First Tripolitanian Republic
description: We have finally managed to liberate ourselves and can now proclaim the first Tripolitanian Republic! While the journey ahead will be perilous we can finally join the world as an independent nation.

name: Organise Paramilitary Youth Organisation
description: The young of Tripolitania will carry the torch of our republic long into the future and should be mobilised for the task ahead into a paramilitary organisation to defend the republic.

name: Pursue Anti-Confessionalism
description: Confessionalism is an affront to our new republic and must be removed. Religion shall have no place in the politics of the new republic.

name: Dismantle Senussi Zawiyas
description: The Zawiya lodges gave great influence to the Senussis and as such should be dismantled so as to prevent Senussi influence bleeding into our politics.

name: Maintain Sectarian Characteristics
description: Sectarianism itself is not inherently bad and should characteristics of it shall be allowed to continue in our politics to promote peace and unity.

name: Encourage Inter-Tribal Dialogue
description: We are land of many diverse tribal identities and this inevitably leads to conflict. If we are to secure the existence of peace within the nation we must encourage the tribes to cooperate.

name: Arabisation of the Administration
description: We are an Arab state and as such the administration for such a state should seek to reflect this reality.

name: Regulate the Bureau for Immigration
description: As part of our new state building we will have to establish a special government branch to handle and regulate immigration into our new republic.

name: Tripolitanian State Building
description: Building a state up from the ashes is a tremendously difficult task but one that is necessary and shall be completed for the betterment of our republic.

name: Curb Regional Authority
description: As part of our program of state building we should seek to centralise the government by significantly reducing the powers of regional authorities.

name: Diminish Misrata Influence
description: A centre of trade in the region, Misrata's influence has the potential to hamper our state building program and so should be defanged.

name: Abolish Fezzani Autonomy
description: The Fezzan region to the south has been autonomous for some time due to its geography. If we are to properly build a centralised state it must be reintegrated into the fold.

name: Development Bank of Tripoli
description: Due to our poor financial situation it has been proposed we establish a special investment bank to help stimulate the Tripoli economy.

name: Expand Irrigation in the Jabal
description: Due to the arid state of much of our nation we should look into expanding irrigation programs to better support our agricultural industry.

name: Agricultural Processing Industry
description: Agriculture itself is just but a part of a greater puzzle and if we can expand into processing we can reap great rewards.

name: Expand the Misrata Munition Factory
description: Our military industry is greatly lacking and so plans to establish a munitions factory in Misrata should receive our full go ahead.

name: Standardise Military Equipment
description: Military equipment within the republic is a diverse assortment and this makes supplying our troops a challenge. By standardising all equipment our forces will be better supplied and organised.

name: Shuffle the Military Cabinet
description: The time has come to reshuffle the high command and introduce new ideas and doctrines to better refine our military forces.

name: Tripolitanian Conscription Law
description: Military conscription is a tenuous affair and to ensure a steady supply of reinforcements for our military we should look into standardising conscription laws.

name: Study Ottoman Military Doctrine
description: The Ottomans did not get to where they were through sheer luck but instead through military ingenuity. By studying their actions we can better refine ours.

name: Strengthen Ottoman Ties
description: The relation between Tripolitania and the Porte has always been a complicated one, derived from its distance from the capital and its substantial population of Turks. Unlike many of our Arab brethren, we don't believe in the total destruction of the Turkish state but recognise the potential of cooperation on equal terms. Turkey may be weakened but it still holds significant cards and Tripoli will need everything it can get.

name: Kouloughli Cultural Program
description: The Kouloughlis are the children of Turkish men who settled in Libya after the Ottoman campaigns, and local women. In the eyes of the new Turkish government, these people symbolise the symbiosis between Turkish and Arabian culture, cuisine and brotherhood and the possibilities of future Turkish-Tripolitanian relations.

name: Invite Turkish Military Advisors
description: Our own military forces are lacking and the Ottomans will gladly provide us with advisors to help strengthen our own military forces.

name: Turko-Tripolitanian Economic Union
description: Our economy is desperately weak and by establishing an economic union with the Turks we will have an easily accessible market to trade our goods.

name: Anti-Colonial Committee Cooperation
description: The Communard Anti-Colonial Committee has been instrumental in aiding our people as well as all those oppressed under the boot of imperialism. For our own benefit we should seek to cooperate with them.

name: Partake in the Phalanstère
description: Tripolitania unfortunately lacks a major scientific base and so cooperation with the Phalanstère will be necessary to increase our research efforts.

name: Internationale Industrial Assistance
description: The Internationale has shown an interest in providing funds to help expand our industrial clout, of which is currently lacking.

name: Restore Tripolitanian Railroads
description: Tripolitania is a desperately backwards economic region and a general lack of capital within the Ottoman Empire has prevented much industrial development. No other sector shows this as clearly as the railways where only a few short tracks around the capital are in existence. With the necessities of war and the clear tactical advantage of opening a North-African front, Communard engineers have been in talks with our government to link the ports of Misrata and Tripoli to the Tunisian border to ensure supply lines.

name: Arms Acquisition Program
description: The Internationale has offered to give us arms and munitions at cheaper rates, naturally we should take them up on this offer.

name: Join the Internationale
description: The time has come for us to ascend onto the world stage and join our brothers in socialism.

name: The Tide of Pan-Arabism
description: We are Arabs by nature and as such we should seek to unify with our Arab brothers by embracing the tide of pan-Arabism!

name: Invite Arab Educators
description: We have much to learn and must properly Arabise our population, to proceed forward we should invite new educators to the nation.

name: Pursue Cyrenaican Cooperation
description: Our brothers to the East are Arab just as we are and so we should seek to maintain friendly relations with them.

name: Join the Cairo Pact
description: The time has come to further our cooperation with our Arab brothers and join the Cairo Pact, the forefront of pan-Arabism.

name: Propose Libyan- Egyptian Unification
description: Throughout the republic whispers of the concept of unifying with our Arab brothers in Egypt have been getting louder and louder and it is time to properly act on this and seek unification.

name: Revitalise the Trans-Sahara Trade
description: The trans-Saharan trade routes have been the bedrock of our economy and if we are to thrive we must see them revitalised.
